Europe's support for Ukraine flags after three years of war
subhead: European leaders are meeting in Brussels on Thursday to reaffirm their commitment to Kyiv, despite discussions on EU enlargement stalling and support for Ukrainian refugees spread out across Europe wavering.

Japan is questioning its alliance with Donald Trump's United States
subhead: Faced with Trump's unpredictable policies, Japanese leaders are considering the need to develop an alternative diplomatic and security strategy to reduce their dependence on the US.

headline: China has enlisted star influencers to boost its global image
subhead: Taiwanese and US influencers share their China trips on social media, seemingly wowed by everything. A state-run media outlet even offers all-expenses-paid trips to influencers with more than 300,000 followers.

headline: 'Once upon a time in Gaza': A Palestinian tragicomedy
subhead: The despairing humor shines through in the latest feature film by brothers Arab and Tarzan Nasser, who won the Best Director award at Cannes in the Un Certain Regard section.

headline: Fariba Adelkhah, anthropologist: 'The Western view of Iranian society is binary and ignores its increasing complexity'
subhead: Challenging the widespread notion that Iranian society is split between 'good' democrats and 'evil' Islamists, the Franco-Iranian researcher argues that most citizens criticize the regime not for its religious orientation, but for its repression of freedoms.

subhead: From flattery to concessions, every detail was arranged to minimize the risk of a diplomatic incident at the NATO summit in The Hague. It is time to change tactics, argues Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

headline: French MPs investigating TikTok: 'Young people are being sacrificed'
subhead: A parliamentary committee investigating TikTok's psychological effects on minors, launched in March under rapporteur Laure Miller and chair Arthur Delaporte, who spoke to Le Monde, wrapped up its hearings on June 24.

headline: New museum will honor Art Nouveau genius Hector Guimard in Paris
subhead: The museum devoted to the architect who designed the Paris metro entrances will be housed in the Hôtel Mezzara, one of his masterpieces. It is expected to open at the end of 2027 or the beginning of 2028.
